stimulusHtml:
Changes in agricultural production and food processing have greatly influenced the contemporary geography of the world’s more developed countries.

  1. Describe ONE way that labor costs influence the location of food processing facilities in more developed countries.
  2. Describe ONE way that the development of large-scale commercial agriculture has affected the use of agricultural technology in the United States and Canada.
  3. Explain how the development of large-scale commercial agriculture has led to the agglomeration of food processing facilities in towns and rural areas of the United States and Canada.
  4. Explain a strength of using the concept of complex commodity chains to understand the production and consumption of ONE of the following:    • orange juice     • hamburger
  5. Explain ONE way that government policies banning genetically modified organisms may favor small family farms over large-scale commercial agriculture.
  6. Explain why farms in countries such as Italy, France, Spain, or Portugal often require seasonal agricultural workers from other countries.
  7. Explain the degree to which migration or border policies in the European Union affect the movement of agricultural laborers among its member countries.
